result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan R Gollier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With 7 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.

Contact Probation & Parole 48 Hours.
Probation Review hearing on December 21, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay DNA surcharge due by 24 months or Civil Judgement.
-Court waived all mandatory and non mandatory costs due to inability to pay.

-Defendant is a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
-Defendant advised he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

-Court will allow expungement upon completion of  probation sentence.
-Court notes expungement will not be contingent of payment of any fees.

-Maintain Absolute sobriety/ Random Urine Screens.
-Obtain Valid Drivers License.
-Provide DNA Sample within 1 week by September 29, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ethan R Gollier

records.addlTxt:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, 7 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply. Probation for 24 months. 45 days of condition time Imposed/Stayed pending probation review.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
Maintain Absolute sobriety/ Random Urine Screens
Perform 40 hours of community service
Obtain Valid Drivers License.
6 Months Revocation of driver's privileges
Provide DNA Sample within 1 week by September 29, 2022.
Pay DNA surcharge due by 24 months or Civil Judgement.
Court waived all mandatory and non mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
Defendant s a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Defendant advised he may not vote until his civil rights are restored 
Contact Probation & Parole 48 Hours.
Court will allow expungement upon completion of  probation sentence.
Court notes expungement will not be contingent of payment of any fees.

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Ethan R Gollier.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Pleas/sentencing hearing. 
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
 Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and  he may not vote in any election until his her civil rights are restored. 

Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 


AS TO COUNT 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case proceeds to sentencing/  case is adjourned for sentencing.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court. 
Alexandria S. Carlson for Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Poznanski had a family emergency and is unable to appear in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has had opportunity to review Discovery and Offer and feels resolution is near.  Case is adjourned in Branch 45 for plea and sentencing.  mn  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to review discovery.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (11  pages) commencing  02-10-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  John D. Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer T. Panich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No driving without a valid license and registration.

Defendant Ethan R Gollier in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Ethan R Gollier in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ethan R Gollier appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
